segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and the further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document name code), such as Pick-up notice, Arrival notice.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and/or time applying to the whole message, such as date and time of document or message issue.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference relating to the whole message, and its date and/or time.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - container pre-notification reference number

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by inland carriers, such as mode and means of transport, arrival date and time.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the inland transport stage (road, rail or inland water), such as mode, voyage number/indication inland transport, identification and type of transport means and inland carrier.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the date(s) and time(s) related to the inland transport.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify an additional reference related to transport details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to indicate locations at which the inland means of transport is to arrive.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to indicate locations such as place or port of arrival.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the arrival date and time of an inland means of transport, such as: - arrival date/time, estimated

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and related contacts.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department of a message sender and/or message recipient, such as: - information contact

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to describe the goods items (to be) stuffed in containers.

segment.name: Goods item details
segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item (to be) stuffed in containers. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item, such as: - hazardous cargo

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.name: Temperature
segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for a goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify documents related to the goods item.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to indicate a document related to the goods item.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date/time related to the document, such as: - document/message date/time - expiry date.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location related to the document, such as: - place of document issue

segment.name: Split goods placement
segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify the containers in which goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to specify dangerous goods.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, and dangerous goods code.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify the proper shipping name of the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: SG14-SG16 A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify a container, size and type used in the transport and full/empty indication; also to specify the type of rail car on which a related container is transported.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with the container, such as: - container sequence number - container announcement reference number - referring container sequence number - release order reference number - acceptance order reference

segment.name: Number of units
segment.documentation: EQN, A segment which can be used in case container numbers are not yet known by the carrier.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - gross weight

segment.name: Dimensions
segment.documentation: DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to provide processable supplementary information associated with the equipment such as controlled atmosphere particulars.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to specify percentages related to the equipment such as percentage humidity.

segment.name: Seal number
segment.documentation: SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the container, such as shipper, consolidator, carrier (sea) and Customs.

segment.name: Attached equipment
segment.documentation: EQA, A segment to identify related container and means of transport details (rail), such as: - rail car (to relate to the 'rail car'-qualified EQD-group)

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions related to the container equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by sea, such as mode and means of transport, arrival date and time.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as carrier or liner service: - main carriage (sea)

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the means of transport (main carriage).

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to provide a reference for the liner service, such as: - conference - marketing organization - syndicate - vessel sharing agreement.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to indicate details of the main carriage (movement of containers by sea).

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to indicate locations such as (final) discharge ports: - final place or port of discharge

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a related address or party, such as: - ordering customer (for container announcement) - agent/representative of the ordering customer (for container announcement) - final place of positioning

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations which apply, the class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods codes, the United Nations Dangerous Goods (UNDG) number and the shipment flash point.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as dangerous goods technical name and dangerous goods additional information.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify contact information.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding dangerous goods.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify communication details of the dangerous goods contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.name: Temperature
segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
